questions.question: Which organelle is responsible for the synthesis of lipids in a eukaryotic cell?
Which molecule forms the basic structure of all biological membranes?
What is the function of lysosomes?
Which type of bond holds the two strands of a DNA molecule together?
Which of the following correctly describes an enzyme's active site?
options: A region that permanently changes shape during catalysis
A region with a specific shape that binds to a substrate
A region that binds to any molecule of similar size
A region made entirely of fatty acids

questions.question: Which statement describes the induced-fit model of enzyme action?
options: The enzyme and substrate fit perfectly without any change in shape
The enzyme changes shape slightly to fit the substrate more closely
The substrate changes shape to fit the enzyme
The active site is rigid and does not alter

questions.question: Which statement best describes osmosis?
options: Movement of water from a high solute concentration to a low solute concentration
Movement of water from a low solute concentration to a high solute concentration through a partially permeable membrane
Movement of solute molecules through a membrane without energy
Active movement of water using ATP

questions.question: What is the function of the Golgi apparatus?
Which process describes the movement of molecules down their concentration gradient?
Which of the following is a feature of prokaryotic cells but not eukaryotic cells?
Which of the following best describes a condensation reaction?
options: Forming a bond by removing water

questions.question: What is the role of ATP in cells?

Which term describes the net movement of particles from an area of high concentration to an area of low concentration?
Which component of a phospholipid is hydrophobic?
Which organelle contains circular DNA and 70S ribosomes?
Which statement describes the role of cholesterol in cell membranes?
options: It increases membrane fluidity at high temperatures
It stabilises the membrane and reduces permeability
It is involved in active transport

questions.question: Which molecule is formed when two monosaccharides join together?
